meanings.sent1: She will act in the school play tomorrow.

meanings.definition: A single performance of a play or show
meanings.sent1: The school play had a great act by the lead actor.
meanings.sent2: The act received a standing ovation from the audience.
meanings.sent3: The act of the magician amazed everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness towards others is the main act of her character.
meanings.sent5: The act of kindness shown by the stranger left a lasting impact on me.

meanings.definition: A formal written record of a decision made by a legislative body
meanings.sent1: The official act was signed by the president.
meanings.sent2: The act contains the details of the new law.
meanings.sent3: The act of Congress was carefully reviewed by the committee.
meanings.sent4: The act serves as a historical document of the government's decisions.
meanings.sent5: The act will be archived for future reference by researchers.

meanings.definition: Pretend to be someone or something for entertainment purposes
meanings.sent1: Children love to act out their favorite characters.
meanings.sent2: I can act like a pirate during the costume party.
meanings.sent3: The comedian decided to act as a grumpy old man for the skit.
meanings.sent4: Her smile can act as a mask to hide her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The actor's ability to act convincingly as different personalities is truly remarkable.
